snippet: Medical care has improved greatly in the last century, but even with technological advances it remains far from perfect.
abstract: Dr Lawrence K Altman essay notes that technological advances have allowed medicine to progress more in the last century than in all of previous history; warns that over-reliance on technology, especially on testing and imaging, can lead to abuse by doctors who do not sufficiently rely on their own observational powers.
lead_paragraph: Medical care has improved greatly in the last century, but even with technological advances it remains far from perfect.
